The Bears have made seemingly improbable turnarounds their calling card, with six regular-season wins coming after trailing in the final two minutes. Saturday’s victory came after Green Bay led, 27-24, with four minutes still to play.

Williams, the No. 1 pick in the 2024 draft, has drawn scrutiny and criticism since his NFL debut because of his accuracy; his completion percentage ranked third-worst among this season’s 38 qualified passers.
Yet, his seven fourth-quarter comebacks are the most by any quarterback in NFL history under the age of 25.

“We’re here and I’m going to be here for a while, is my plan,” Williams said. “Be in a bunch of games, be in these moments and come out victorious. That’s the mindset for right now this year. That’s also the mindset for the future.”

One night later, Maye produced a performance against the Los Angeles Chargers that the second-year quarterback said "wasn't his best." Still, his touchdown pass late in the fourth quarter of his first career postseason game sealed New England’s first playoff victory since the 2018 season.
Though both Williams and Maye were better than their older counterparts, Green Bay's Jordan Love and the Chargers' Justin Herbert, youth didn't win out entirely over wisdom during the weekend.

With eight consecutive wins to close the season, 26-year-old Trevor Lawrence and Jacksonville had become a dark horse title contenders. Their playoffs ended after just one game, however, after eight-year veteran Josh Allen scored three touchdowns to lead a Buffalo comeback and earn the Bills' first playoff win on the road in 33 years.
"He definitely carried them," Jacksonville Jaguars coach Liam Coen said of Allen.

Stafford completed six of his seven passes on the Rams' game-winning drive in the final minute to beat Carolina and third-year quarterback Bryce Young on the road Saturday. It keeps alive the Rams' hopes of winning their second Super Bowl in five seasons.
“You see him out there, he just has the best composure of anyone I have ever seen," Rams tight end Colby Parkinson said. "He knows that we are going to go make it happen and we completely trust him."

Although Stafford has been an NFL mainstay for 17 seasons, Saturday marked only his 11th career postseason game. Rams star receiver Puka Nacua said of the comeback, there was "never a doubt — No. 9 (Stafford) is with us."

On the other end of the spectrum, although San Francisco's Brock Purdy is only in his fourth season, the 49ers' win Sunday that knocked out defending champion Philadelphia Eagles was already Purdy's seventh career postseason start.

Two of the most fascinating storylines left in the season center on whether the teams that were the AFC and NFC's best during the regular season can remain so in the playoffs largely because their quarterbacks have either unimpressive or untested playoff credentials.

In the NFC, top-seeded Seattle Seahawks will host the 49ers in next week's division round. Quarterback Sam Darnold, who fell apart with the Minnesota Vikings in last year's postseason, leading him to change teams and sign with Seattle in the offseason, has the chance to prove that his second consecutive superlative regular season was not a fluke.
But San Francisco will not make it easy. Though Darnold threw 25 touchdowns this season, he didn't throw any in two games against the 49ers.

And in the AFC, the Denver Broncos are the top seed for the first time since 2015. That season, they won the Super Bowl with future Hall of Famer Peyton Manning playing the last of his 17 seasons. A decade later, Bo Nix will be making his playoff debut in next week's divisional round, when the Broncos host Buffalo.

Of all the quarterbacks left, Rodgers has by far the most experience. But Pittsburgh, which claimed the last postseason berth on the final play of the regular season, isn't viewed as a favorite to advance to the Super Bowl — which leaves a path for Allen to become the new face of a changing NFL postseason landscape.
Allen is 8-6 in the playoffs in his career. Four of those losses came against Mahomes and the Kansas City Chiefs, who ended Buffalo's season each of the last two years.

With their nemesis, Kansas City, no longer a postseason obstacle, and a majority of the remaining quarterbacks possessing less experience than Allen, the Bills will try to mend the franchise's playoff heartbreak that dates to losing four consecutive Super Bowls between 1990-93.
"When your quarterback’s that type of warrior, that type of competitor, it just goes through the whole team," Bills coach Sean McDermott said Sunday.
Whether Allen can finally go through the whole postseason and emerge a champion is now the question.

title: Noah Wyle Puts His Golden Globe Beside the Real Award, a Homemade ‘Best Dad’ Trophy
summary: Noah Wyle celebrated his Golden Globe Award win by sharing a photo of the trophy beside a handmade "best dad" award.
story: Noah Wyle had a great Golden Globes night.
“The Pitt” leading man took home the award for best TV male actor — drama, calling it a “truly humbling moment” during his acceptance speech.
This marked the 54-year-old actor's first Golden Globe, but that night he also nabbed a second award that just might be a touch more special.
On Jan. 12, a day after the awards show, Wyle shared a photo of his Golden Globe alongside a handmade “best dad” trophy made out of tin foil.
“What an incredible night. My heart is full,” the actor captioned the Instagram post.
Wyle shares son Owen, 24, and daughter Auden, 20, with his ex-wife, Tracy Warbin, and daughter Frances, 10, with his wife, Sara Wyle.
The former “ER” star attended the Globes with Sara Wyle, whom he gave a shoutout to during his speech.
“I’ve been supported by an incredible wife and three great children all along the way,” he said.
His daughter Auden Wyle praised him on her Instagram story after his win, writing, “The most dedicated father, human, artist and advocate.”
“My first inspiration and the greatest best friend. It is the biggest gift in the world to watch you shine,” she continues. “We love you so much.”
Last year, after winning two Emmys for "The Pitt," he told People that it's "really beautiful" to share the success with his family.

“To see my kids be proud of me and to have this be meaningful for them, for me, it has been really amazing,” he told the magazine in September 2025. “You always hope your kids know how hard you work. You always hope your kids know how much of yourself you fit into what you do by example for them.”
Adding, “This last year, I’ve really felt that they’ve been listening and watching and it’s been impactful.”

title: Leonardo DiCaprio Created '100 Memes in 30 Seconds' During Golden Globes Commercial Break That Went Viral
summary: Leonardo DiCaprio went viral for his facial expressions during a commercial break at the Golden Globes. See the moment.
story: Leonardo DiCaprio showed a playful side of himself at the 2026 Golden Globes.

During a commercial break, the "One Battle After Another" actor was seen speaking to someone nearby, who wasn't shown on-camera. During the interaction, which was captured without audio, DiCaprio was seen smiling, mouthing words and making hand gestures.

In the comments of a TikTok shared by the Golden Globes, a fan joked that DiCaprio "created (a) hundred memes in 30sec" in the video. Many said the clip reminded them of the actor's viral "Django Unchained" meme where his character laughs while taking a sip of wine.
The clip showed a new side to DiCaprio, fans said. "Leo in 'public' and leo in private such a different vibe ... he should open up more :))," a TikTok user wrote.
Others picked up on his animated facial expressions. Someone wrote, "Dude just showed his acting range while sitting on the table at the Globes 😂."

As for what he was saying? It remains a mystery — though people think, by lip reading, he referencing K-pop. The movie "KPOP Demon Hunters" won best original song for "Golden" and best animated feature.
"Translation — 'I was watching you with the K pop thing, you were like, who’s that, is that, Oh, K pop,'" a fan guessed.

At the 2026 Golden Globes, DiCaprio was nominated in the category of best actor in a movie (comedy or musical) for his work in "One Battle After Another." He ended up losing to Timothée Chalamet for his work in "Marty Supreme."
The "Wolf of Wall Street" actor also got roasted by host Nikki Glaser in her monologue, especially when she poked fun at DiCaprio's dating history.

“What a career you’ve had, countless iconic performances, you’ve worked with every great director, you’ve won three Golden Globes, an Oscar and the most impressive thing is you were able to accomplish all of that before your girlfriend turned 30,” Glaser joked.
She immediately apologized and explained why she felt she had to joke about it.

“Leo, I’m sorry I made that joke, it’s cheap, I tried not to,” Glaser said. “But we don’t know anything else about you, man. There’s nothing else ... I searched, the most in-depth interview you’ve ever given was in Teen Beat in 1991. Is your favorite food still ‘pasta, pasta and more pasta’?”
DiCaprio confirmed that it was.

title: ‘Heated Rivalry’ Author Rachel Reid Is Writing Another Book About Shane and Ilya
summary: See a synopsis and cover for "Unrivaled," a new book in Rachel Reid's "Game Changers" series that includes "Heated Rivalry."
story: Shane and Ilya’s story is set to continue on screen, with the breakout hockey romance “Heated Rivalry” renewed for Season 2. Now, their story will develop further on the page, too.

Rachel Reid, the author of “Heated Rivalry” and its sequel “The Long Game,” will release a third installment in the love story of hockey stars Shane Hollander and Ilya Rozanov, who begin as rivals before embarking on a yearslong affair.
Titled “Unrivaled,” the book promises to pick up right where “The Long Game” picks up.
(A warning for show fans: “The Long Game” may contain spoilers for the yet-to-be-filmed Season 2 of “Heated Rivalry.”)
Here’s what to know about “Unrivaled.”
When Is ‘Unrivaled’ Coming Out?
“Unrivaled,” by Rachel Reid, will come out Sept. 29, 2026. The romance novel will be published by Harlequin Books, a division of HarperCollins.
How to Pre-Order ‘Unrivaled’
“Unrivaled” is available for pre-order wherever books are sold, including the Harlequin website, Barnes & Noble, Books-A-Million and more.
🚨 Warning: The rest of this story contains spoilers about Shane and Ilya’s journey.
What Is ‘Unrivaled’ About?
“Unrivaled” will tell the next phase of Shane and Ilya’s story, which began with 2019’s “Heated Rivalry” and continued in 2022’s “The Long Game.”
Based on the synopsis for “Unrivaled,” the book will follow Shane and Ilya’s relationship as they navigate being out and facing discrimination from some sectors of the professional hockey world.
A line has been drawn—and the hockey world is divided.

For the first time in their professional hockey careers, Ilya Rozanov and Shane Hollander have nothing to hide. After more than a decade of keeping their love secret, they’re out, married, and even playing on the same team. The support has been incredible.
Most of the time.

While fans celebrate them, others in the hockey world are still reeling from the reveal. A growing backlash—led by the popular hockey podcast Top Shelf and the #TakeBackHockey movement—is making its presence felt.
Standing together in the light was everything Shane and Ilya ever wanted. Now, they may be facing their biggest challenge yet.
Wait, Shane and Ilya Are Married?
Yes!
Major spoilers ahead for the plot of Reid’s “The Long Game.”

“The Long Game” follows Shane and Ilya through their committed, yet hidden, relationship as they each navigate their hockey ambitions. Shane stays focused on the Stanley Cup while Ilya struggles with keeping their love secret and begins to reckon with his own mental health struggles.

After a blowout fight, a near plane crash, and of course, plenty of steamy scenes, Shane and Ilya get engaged. But their relationship is soon made public when they are seen kissing in the back of a viral video. As they deal with coming out not on their terms and against the wishes of the leaders of their hockey league, they decide to be open about their relationship.

And after facing discrimination from his longtime Montreal team, Shane ends up joining Ilya to play for the on-the-rise Ottawa pro team. The book ends with them about to start their first season playing on the same team.

title: The Best Dressed Stars of the 2026 Golden Globes, According to Fashion Experts
summary: See the best dressed looks from the 2026 Golden Globes. Fashion experts pick the best looks and explain why.
story: Maybe you watch the award show to find out who wins — or maybe you’re more interested in what they wore. At the 2026 Golden Globes, there was enough of both to keep you entertained either way.
According to stylist and designer June Ambrose, who appeared on TODAY with Jenna & Sheinelle on Jan. 12, the carpet felt “edgy and glamorous.”
“The girls and guys brought sexy back,” Ambrose said.
Obvious trends red carpet included a series of daring black dresses, worn by Teyana Taylor, Jenna Ortega and Sara Foster.
Jennifer Lawrence and Jennifer Lopez both opted for sheer fabrics, with Lawrence’s looking more earth and Lopez’s more flashy.

Bold colors made their way onto the red carpet, too, with Wunmi Mosaku, Rose Byrne and Laufey, among others, making a statement. Mosaku wrote in Vogue that she wore a yellow dress to announce her pregnancy thanks to a Yoruba phrase, “Mother is golden.”

During a Jan. 12 segment on TODAY with Jenna & Sheinelle, Ambrose, Zanna Roberts Rassi and Jenna Lyons shouted out their favorite picks. Fashion editor AK Brown and designer Hayley Paige also shared their standout looks with TODAY.com.
Below, find the Golden Globes outfits the experts loved this year and why.
Teyana Taylor

For the event, Taylor wore a custom Schiaparelli gown — which she showed off even further when she went on stage to collect her award. Zanna Roberts Rassi said Taylor didn't work with a stylist to create the work, but rather directly with designer D Rosebury.
Jennifer Lawrence
Ambrose said, during her appearance on TODAY with Jenna & Sheinelle, this dress "surprised" her the most. She likened the dress to Beyoncé's 2015 Met Gala look, where she wore a sheer gold gown.
Stylist Paige, in a statement to TODAY.com, said the dress "reflects an actor who understands nuance: confident, layered, and fully in control."
Selena Gomez

Selena Gomez, who walked the red carpet with her husband, Benny Blanco, went for an old Hollywood look. The “I Said I Love You First” singer wore a strapless Chanel gown that was embellished with white manmade feathers.
Rassi shared that Gomez’s look was very intentional. “Her stylist, Erin, told me it was created to represent exactly where Selena is at — ‘Joy meets elegance!’” she said.
“The glam was a slam!” Rassi added of Gomez’s look.
Timothée Chalamet
Chalamet sported a stunning velvet Chrome Hearts suit with a Cartier watch and a pair of Chrome Hearts x Timbaland boots.
According to Rassi, Chalamet looked very dapper like a “modern day Johnny Depp,” who was paying “homage to New York” with his footwear.
Ayo Edebiri
Edebiri opted for an off-the-shoulder, black velvet Chanel dress embellished with resin and pearl brooches.

According to Rassi, Edebiri's stylist had "gasped" when she first saw Edebiri's look on the runway. It was then she knew that her client would look great in the gown, so she sent it to "The Bear" actor, and she "loved" it.
Emily Blunt and John Krasinski
For the 2026 Golden Globes, Blunt wore a stunning Louis Vuitton gown, while her husband, John Krasinski, donned a dapper Dolce & Gabbana suit.
Rassi, on TODAY with Jenna & Sheinelle, called them the "best dressed couple in town," looking like a "modern day bride and groom."
Ambrose also spoke about the look and said "The Devil Wears Prada" actor looked like a modern Jackie Onassis, while Krasinski gave off a "smoky and sexy" vibe to him, likening him to Bruce Wayne.
Patrick Schwarzenegger
Of the "White Lotus" star's look, and daring accessories, Lyons said, "He really went there." He wore a Dolce & Gabbana suit paired with a broach, glasses and bowtie.
Rose Bryne
Byrne's emerald green dress took 210 hours to perfect, thanks to its 4,660 embroidered elements, including glass pearls and crystals, per Vogue. But what really stands out is the green hue.
“If you’re going to make the color the statement it has to be the perfect color,” Rassi said.
“Her stylist Kate told me they designed this dress in toile white then held up swatches of six different greens to get the perfect tone,” she continued.
Claire Danes
Rassi said that Danes had one of the “comfiest” and “cleverest” looks of the night. Her Zac Posen gown was inspired by a classic Gap T-shirt.
Walton Goggins
Ambrose shouted out Goggins’ outfit as her “wild card” choice. The “White Lotus” star wore a a gold lamé shirt under classic tailoring.
Of the look, Paige said, “The contrast between rigid suiting and fluid metallic fabric felt theatrical but controlled, confident, and slightly dangerous in the best way."
Colman Domingo
Paige said the combination of Colman Domingo’s black Valentino suit, plus the delicate appliqué along the lapel, is “proof that menswear’s most powerful statements are classic with a twist.”
Rei Ami
Rei Ami coordinated with the rest of the "KPOP Demon Hunters" singers in black dresses designed by Thom Browne and Valdrin Sahiti.
Paige said Rei Ami's black corset gown, designed by Sahiti, "leaned into femme-fatale energy, but with modern precision," adding, "This wasn’t about a role, it was about persona."
Kate Hudson
Hudson wore a vintage Armani gown from the company’s 2007 collection. However, the dress was given an update for the Golden Globes. The new version was more sheer and had new beading.
While speaking to Rassi, Hudson said her “toughest fashion critic” is Rani, her 7-year-old daughter, whom she shares with her fiancé, Danny Fujikawa.
Paige called Hudson an "art-deco goddess," but with "modern ease."
Renate Reinsve
Renate Reinsve, star of “Sentimental Value,” wore a dress with 800,000 beads, according to Vogue. The piece, designed by Nicolas Ghesquière, was a favorite with experts.
“I’m into this whole clean, shimmer, streamlined dress. Simple makeup, no jewels,” Lyons shared with TODAY with Jenna & Sheinelle.
Brown was also a fan of Reinsve's look.

"The look was very calculated as it focused on texture, movement, and proportion without overdoing it. The dress was the statement — the lack of jewelry and even her hair were intentional to either move with the dress or to allow the dress to stand on its own," she told TODAY.com.
Kylie Jenner
Kylie Jenner didn’t walk the red carpet, but sat next to her boyfriend, Timothée Chalamet, who won best actor in a drama for “Marty Supreme.” She showed her gold gown in more detail on her Instagram.
Paige called the look by Ashi Studio "luminous, sculpted, and precise." The gown "mirrored the prestige-film gravitas of Timothée Chalamet’s moment with quiet, cinematic confidence," in her words.
Nikki Glaser
Nikki Glaser started the night off in a pink ballgown, then changed into a striking red dress for her opening monologue. Paige says the outfits helped solidify her as “ringleader” of the night.
“That opening red look was power dressing with a sense of humor: bold, confident and impossible to ignore without ever distracting from the show,” Paige said.
Skye P. Marshall
Marshall showed up at the Golden Globes in a breathtaking Lever Couture gown. Brown says Marshall’s look “promoted her radiance through movement."
Chase Infiniti

Infiniti made her debut at the Golden Globes a memorable one. The "One Battle After Another" star wore a Louis Vuitton dress that caught Brown's attention. Brown said Infiniti had "one of the most architecturally compelling pieces of the night."
Ginnifer Goodwin
Ginnifer Goodwin walked the red carpet in a long-sleeved black Armani gown adorned with pearls and Swarovski crystals. Brown called it the perfect balance of "drama" and "elegance."
Glen Powell
"Old-Hollywood codes, modern restraint," Paige said of Powell's look, designed by Brunello Cucinelli. She said the moment signaled "leading-man confidence without shouting for attention."
Even the glasses mattered: charm, but of course, with intellect," she continued.
Sara Foster
Paige says Foster’s look was “restrained, editorial, and self-possessed,” reading as “creative authority” — fitting for her role as the creator of Netflix’s “Nobody Wants This.”

title: Jenna & Sheinelle Debut Their New Theme Song by an Artist They Both Adore
summary: TODAY with Jenna & Sheinelle debuted its new theme song by artist Blessing Offor.
story: TODAY with Jenna & Sheinelle is here — and there’s some feel-good music to welcome everyone to the party!
Jenna Bush Hager and Sheinelle Jones walked onto their set in Studio 1A on Jan. 12 for their first show together to a new theme song that got the pair moving and smiling.
“Can we hear that song again?” Sheinelle asked after the duo sat down. “Can we crank it up?”
Revisit all the fun from Jenna & Sheinelle’s first show.
“Let’s hear it,” Jenna said.
The new co-hosts then started dancing to the upbeat ditty, while Sheinelle invited everyone in the studio to dance with them.

“By the way, can we thank our dear friend Blessing Offor who wrote that song just for us?” Jenna said about the new theme. “He’s an amazing friend — and we have a whole story behind it — but the fact that he would give his time for us means so much.”

Before Sheinelle could get into how she was handling her first day on the job, she had to circle back to the theme song. Sheinelle started by sharing that Jenna had sent her a tune by Blessing, called “Brighter Days,” when she was feeling “really low” one day while filling in as a guest co-host on TODAY with Jenna & Friends.
“And the fact that now, who would’ve thunk — (him) singing the theme song with our names in it for this show is nuts! Nuts!” Sheinelle said while energetically tapping her fingers on her desk.
In December, Sheinelle was named co-host of TODAY’s fourth hour after Jenna’s year-long search for a desk mate. Jenna had sat with more than 60 guest co-hosts last year on TODAY with Jenna & Friends.

“You all know her, she’s an extraordinary broadcaster, but more importantly, she exemplifies exactly what this show is all about,” Jenna said on TODAY with Jenna & Friends while introducing Sheinelle.
“To have a show like this is beyond my wildest dreams,” Sheinelle said. “This is the real deal, and I get to do it with Jenna.”

title: EXCLUSIVE: Mary J. Blige Announces Las Vegas Residency. How to Get Tickets
summary: Mary J. Blige will headline her first Las Vegas residency, with dates in May and July, it she revealed exclusively on TODAY.
story: Mary J. Blige will headline her first Las Vegas residency, the R&B icon revealed Jan. 12 on TODAY.
“Mary J. Blige: My Life, My Story The Las Vegas Residency” will kick off May 1 at Dolby Live at Park MGM. There will be five shows in May and another five in July.
“That’s major for me,” she told Craig Melvin live on TODAY. “Vegas is the big time.”
She explained the dynamics of the show and how it will be more of a storytelling experience.

“It’s going to be done more theatrical,” she said. “It’s still going to have the music, it’s still going to be fun — but it’s a story so there’s going to be actors and actresses. So the music tells the story. I have so many songs I haven’t performed yet for my fans. ... The actors are going to narrate the music.”
Interested in catching Blige in Sin City? Read on for more information.

Blige will perform at Dolby Live at Park MGM the following dates. All shows begin at 8 p.m. local time.

title: What Nikki Glaser Said In Her 2026 Golden Globes Monologue
summary: Nikki Glaser kept the jokes and the jabs coming at the 2026 Golden Globes
story: Nikki Glaser kept the jokes and the jabs coming at the 2026 Golden Globes.
The comedian returned to host the annual awards ceremony, live from the Beverly Hilton in Los Angeles on Jan. 11.

Glaser made history last year as the first woman to host the Globes solo, and proved that she was more than ready to tackle the big gig. Ahead of this year's Golden Globes, she told TODAY.com, "I’m working with all of the same people. I’m going to all the same clubs to work on the material. I am thinking about the celebrity’s point of view."
When her moment arrived, Glaser appeared on the stage in an off-the-shoulder red gown, a quick wardrobe change from her pink red carpet look, as Taylor Swift's "Style" blasted in the background.
Read on for a full recap of Glaser's 2026 Golden Globes monologue.
What Did Nikki Glaser Say in Her Opening Monologue?
Glaser made her way through most of the nominees, poking fun at many of the stars — and herself.
Here are some of the highlights:

"Just like 'Frankenstein,' I've been pieced together by an unlicensed European surgeon and good work." "There's so many A-listers — and by A-listers, I do mean people who are on a list that has been heavily redacted." "The award for most editing goes to CBS News. Yes, CBS News, America's newest place to see BS news.""George Clooney is nominated tonight for the movie 'Jay Kelly.' Yes, where he plays George Clooney. He was so good.""Kevin Hart is here. Yes, The Rock's plus one-half...Kevin, you're so funny, and you and The Rock together are like my favorite comedy duo. You're, like, a Steve Martin and Martin Short, but for, like, people under 50 IQ." "How good was Leo in 'One Battle'? It is insane. So good, so vaping good. What a career you've had. I mean, countless iconic performances. You've worked with every great director. You've won three Golden Globes, an Oscar. And the most impressive thing is that you were able to accomplish all of that before your girlfriend turned 30. "You know, everyone in this town is obsessed with looking younger. Meanwhile, Sean Penn is like, 'What if I slowly morph into a sexy leather handbag?'""I can't believe it. We got two Michael B. Jordans. When I saw that, I was like, 'Nikki be jerking, because that was awesome.'" "Timothée Chalamet is the first actor in history who had to put on muscle for a movie about ping pong. He gained over 60 ounces. It's insane. "
"Just like 'Frankenstein,' I've been pieced together by an unlicensed European surgeon and good work."
"There's so many A-listers — and by A-listers, I do mean people who are on a list that has been heavily redacted."
"The award for most editing goes to CBS News. Yes, CBS News, America's newest place to see BS news."
"George Clooney is nominated tonight for the movie 'Jay Kelly.' Yes, where he plays George Clooney. He was so good."

"Kevin Hart is here. Yes, The Rock's plus one-half...Kevin, you're so funny, and you and The Rock together are like my favorite comedy duo. You're, like, a Steve Martin and Martin Short, but for, like, people under 50 IQ."

"How good was Leo in 'One Battle'? It is insane. So good, so vaping good. What a career you've had. I mean, countless iconic performances. You've worked with every great director. You've won three Golden Globes, an Oscar. And the most impressive thing is that you were able to accomplish all of that before your girlfriend turned 30.
"You know, everyone in this town is obsessed with looking younger. Meanwhile, Sean Penn is like, 'What if I slowly morph into a sexy leather handbag?'"
"I can't believe it. We got two Michael B. Jordans. When I saw that, I was like, 'Nikki be jerking, because that was awesome.'"
"Timothée Chalamet is the first actor in history who had to put on muscle for a movie about ping pong. He gained over 60 ounces. It's insane. "
Reactions to Nikki Glaser’s Opening Monologue
So far, Glaser has received overwhelmingly positive reactions on social media to her monologue.
"Truly, why doesn’t Nikki Glaser host every awards show? She’s absolutely killing this monologue right now," one X user asked.

"Nikki Glaser didn’t repeat herself," another said. "She raised the bar. One year after redefining what a Golden Globes host could be, she came back and delivered one of the sharpest, most assured opening monologues the show has had in a decade. At this point, it isn’t a gamble. It’s a standard."
A third X user said, "Nikki Glaser roasting CBS on CBS is iconic."
"Few things will make me change the channel from the NFL playoffs, but a Nikki Glaser opening monologue at the Golden Globes will," one person tweeted.

title: How to Watch the 2026 Golden Globes on TV, Online — And For Free
summary: Find everything you need to know to watch the 2026 Golden Globes on Sunday, January 11. See what time it starts, what channel it's on, and how to stream it live.
story: The 2026 award season has officially begun, kicking off with the 83rd annual Golden Globes on Sunday, Jan 11.
The ceremony, hosted by Nikki Glaser for the second year in a row, is promised to be a star-studded event, with Hollywood greats attending one of the entertainment industry’s big nights.

Only at the Golden Globes could Leonardo DiCaprio, nominated for “One Battle After Another,” mingle with the cast of Season 3 of “The White Lotus.” Other nominees across film and TV include Michael B. Jordan for “Sinners,” Timothée Chalamet for “Marty Supreme” and Emma Stone for “Bugonia.”
Prior to the ceremony starting, there will be a series of red carpet pre-shows.
Continue reading to learn more about how to tune in to the ceremony, and follow along for live updates on the Golden Globes here.
What Time Do the 2026 Golden Globes Start?
The ceremony starts at 8 p.m. ET / 5 p.m. PT.
What Channel Is the 2026 Golden Globes On?
The Golden Globes will air live on CBS.
Those without a cable subscription can access the Golden Globes through subscriptions to DirectTV Live, Hulu + Live TV, Sling TV and Fubo, many of which offer a free trial.
Where Is the 2026 Golden Globes Streaming?
The Golden Globes can be streamed live through:
Paramount+ with ShowtimeCBS.com with a cable subscription
Paramount+ with Showtime
CBS.com with a cable subscription
Who Is Hosting the 2026 Golden Globes?
Comedian Nikki Glaser will return to host the Golden Globes for the second year in a row after her performance last year was incredibly well-received.

“Usually, you do something and there’s a couple of people who don’t like what you did — or a couple flaws you can find — and it was universally appreciated and well-reviewed. I’m not used to that,” Glaser told The Hollywood Reporter of hosting last year’s Golden Globes ceremony.

She continued, “But I just went back and watched it two days ago just to remind myself of what I liked, what I didn’t like. Well, damn, I kind of nailed it. And it scares me, because that was kind of lightning in a bottle. I got really lucky with some of the nominees. Everything worked out. So it’s a high bar. I’m kind of screwed.”

title: Hailee Steinfeld and Josh Allen's Relationship Timeline
summary: Hailee Steinfeld and Josh Allen have been linked since 2023. Here's what to know about their relationship timeline including when they first met.
story: Hailee Steinfeld found her perfect match in Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen.

Both Allen and Steinfeld had a busy Jan. 11. Hours before Steinfeld was set to present an award at the Golden Globes, Allen and the Bills won their AFC Wild Card playoff game against the Jacksonville Jaguars.

The "Sinners" star and the quarterback are at the top of their respective games, and they're building an empire together. Here's what to know about Allen and Steinfeld's relationship — and the family that they're growing.
August 2023: Josh Allen Publicly Addresses Relationship for the 1st Time
Months are the pair were first spotted together on a night out in New York in May 2023, Allen addressed the relationship.

During an appearance on the "Pardon My Take" podcast in August 2023, co-host Dan Katz asked Allen about his relationship with Steinfeld. After initially avoiding the question, he eventually referenced their relationship.
The hosts asked about Allen's trip to Mexico in July of that year, where paparazzi had taken and published intimate photographs of him and Steinfeld kissing.
"I saw it and I just like felt this gross feeling," Allen said on the podcast."Insecurity. No privacy. It was just like, 'What is wrong with these people?'"
Allen explained that the paparazzi hid on a boat in order to snap the pictures.
October 2023: Steinfeld Supports the Buffalo Bills
Steinfeld cheered on the Buffalo Bills at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium in London during their match the Jacksonville Jaguars.
January 2024: Steinfeld Shuts Down Engagement Accusations
At the 2024 Golden Globes awards, Steinfeld wore an elegant diamond ring on her right hand to the ceremony, sparking rumors that Allen had proposed.
When asked about the ring, Steinfeld shut down the rumors.
"No particular reason other than I just thought it was real cute," Steinfeld told E! News.
July 2024: Allen Hard Launches the Relationship
Allen officially announced his relationship status with Steinfeld in a post to Instagram.
The post featured a carousel of pictures from his summer, with several photos of Steinfeld. The post was caption "Onward 🤘🏼", and showed Steinfeld with the Allen family.
October 2024: Steinfeld and Allen Co-Host a Halloween Party
Steinfeld and Allen hosted a Halloween celebration for the Buffalo Bills players and their partners to attend. The event was circus themed, and Steinfeld and Allen dressed up as the ring masters.
November 2024: An Engagement Is Announced
At the end of November 2024, Allen proposed to Steinfeld on a ledge overlooking the waterfront as the sun was setting. The pair shared a picture from the day through a joint Instagram post.
February 2025: She Gets a Shoutout in a Speech

At the 2025 NFL Honors awards, Steinfeld and Allen shared their relationship by appearing on the red carpet together. It was an exciting night for Allen because he won the Most Valuable Player (MVP) award at the end of the night.
When accepting the award, Allen thanked Steinfeld in his speech.
"My fiancé Hailee, you are my rock. You are my best friend. I would not be standing on this stage if it were not for you."
May 2025: They Get Married in California
In a private ceremony held in Santa Barbara, California, the couple tied the knot after over two years together. Steinfeld wore a simple strapless dress paired with long white gloves and a veil.
Steinfeld posted a collage of Polaroid photos to her Instagram with the caption "HUSBAND!"

She wrote about her wedding on her Beau Society newsletter. Among the details? She said she "never more like myself and more beautiful" than she did in her wedding dress, designed by Tamara Ralph. Instead of a bouquet, she said she carried a single crystal flower.
June 2025: Hailee Steinfeld and Josh Allen Honeymoon
The newlyweds went on a tropical vacation to celebrate their honeymoon. Allen posted a collection of photos from the trip with the caption "Wifey ❤️" to Instagram.
December 2025: Hailee Steinfeld Announces She's Expecting
Steinfeld and Allen announced they are expecting their first child together. The pair made the announcement through a video of Allen kissing her baby bump posted to social media.

title: How to Watch the Golden Globes Red Carpet and See All the Best-Dressed Stars
summary: Here's how to watch the Golden Globes red carpet and pre-show on Sunday. Find out what time it starts, what channel it's on, and where to stream it online.
story: Fans are not only tuning in to the Golden Globes to see who wins best actor and best actress, but also to see who takes home the title of best dressed.

Stars from this year's most popular films and television series will walk the red carpet on Jan. 11 at The Beverly Hilton in Beverly Hills, California ahead of the 83rd annual Golden Globes, hosted this year by comedian Nikki Glaser.
Nominees include Kate Hudson ("Song Sung Blue"), Emma Stone ("Bugonia"), Timothée Chalamet ("Marty Supreme"), George Clooney ("Jay Kelly"), Cynthia Erivo and Ariana Grande ("Wicked: For Good").
Continue reading to find out how to watch this year's Golden Globes red carpet.
How to Watch the Golden Globes Red Carpet
E!'s red carpet coverage starts at 6 p.m. ET / 3 p.m. PT and is hosted by Zuri Hall, Justin Sylvester and Keltie Knight. You can watch it in the following places:
E! and USA NetworksUSANetwork.comE! and USA apps on iOS, Android mobile and Apple TV devices
E! and USA Networks
USANetwork.com
E! and USA apps on iOS, Android mobile and Apple TV devices
It will be available to stream next day on Peacock.
ET: Live on the Golden Globes Red Carpet starts at 7 p.m. ET / 4 p.m. PT with Kevin Frazier and Michelle Turner.

Variety’s digital pre-show will be hosted by journalists Angelique Jackson and Marc Malkin. It will stream live starting at 6:30 p.m. ET / 3:30 p.m. PT on variety.com, Variety’s YouTube channel and Fire TV.
The Hollywood Reporter and Spotify are collaborating to bring their own Golden Globes red carpet coverage, hosted by Kareem Rahma, creator of Subway Talks.
Follow along on The Hollywood Reporter and Spotify’s social media platforms, as well as THR.com.
How to Watch the Golden Globes
The 83rd annual Golden Globes is live on CBS, and streaming on CBS.com and Paramount+ with Showtime and CBS.com, on Sunday, Jan. 11 at 8 p.m. ET / 5 p.m. PT.

title: Ken Jeong Reveals Easter Eggs in ‘The Hangover’ Meant Just for His Wife
summary: When Ken Jeong filmed "The Hangover," he was thinking about his wife."I view maybe the raunchiest, dirtiest movie I’ve ever been a part of, like, the most warm set behind the scenes," he said on Sunday Sitdown Jan.
story: When Ken Jeong filmed "The Hangover," he was thinking about his wife.
"I view maybe the raunchiest, dirtiest movie I’ve ever been a part of, like, the most warm set behind the scenes," he said on Sunday Sitdown Jan. 11.

Jeong's wife, Tran, was diagnosed with breast cancer before filming began on the cult classic movie. To try and lift her spirits while she underwent chemotherapy, Jeong said he placed a few Easter eggs in the film to make his wife laugh.

"I’m Korean and she’s Vietnamese and so there was so much nonsense in Mr. Chow," he told Willie Geist about his memorable character. "I would literally just speak gibberish in Vietnamese to make her laugh. I didn’t tell anybody."

Re-enacting what he would say, he added, "It sounds like, 'Release the hostage,' you know? And in Vietnamese, it means, 'chicken thigh.' ... So there’s all these little Easter eggs in the movie that make me and Tran laugh."
Ho has been cancer-free for 18 years. When her husband filmed "The Hangover," he was around 40 years old and didn't know how big the movie would become.
He said people still stop him on the street to recite one of his most notable lines from the film: "Toodle-oo, motherf-----."
"I was at an ATM one day, and this guy in a convertible just stops and just stares at me. And when the light goes green he goes, “Toodle-oo, motherf-----" Jeong laughs. "Just drives away."
"That's my legacy," he added.
In addition to "The Hangover," Jeong joined the cast of NBC's "Community" and went on to appear in other great movies, such as "Crazy Rich Asians" and "Transformers: Dark of the Moon."
Fans can also catch him judging the celebrity competition series "The Masked Singer," which Jeong joked he has no business being a part of.

"I have nothing to do with the music business. And (that's coming) from a guy considered to be one of the smartest people in the business because of my medical background. It is so fitting that I am the dumbest person on that show," he said with a laugh.
Jeong explained that he does his best to provide comedic relief when it's time to guess which singer is behind the mask.

"That’s where the comedy comes in," he says. "I will just do my best enlightened idiot kind of point of view and say, 'I know exactly who that is.' So if I say that, I have no idea and I’m panicking deep, down inside."

title: Who Is Nikki Glaser? All About the Golden Globes Host
summary: Who is Nikki Glaser? What did she say about hosting the Golden Globes? Here's what to know.
story: Nikki Glaser is set to host the Golden Globe Awards for the second year in a row.
She made history in 2025 as the Golden Globes’ first solo woman host. Her daring monologue drew acclaim, which was only to be expected from a comedian who rose to fame for her celebrity roasts.
She was announced as the host of the 2026 awards just months after last year’s ceremony.

“Hosting the Golden Globes this year was without a doubt the most fun I have ever had in my career,” Glaser said in a statement at the time. “I can’t wait to do it again, and this time in front of the team from ‘The White Lotus,’ who will finally recognize my talent and cast me in Season 4 as a Scandinavian Pilates instructor with a shadowy past.”

Glaser has been making people laugh ever since college, where she did stand-up. While pursing a degree in English from the University of Kansas, Glaser appeared on the show “Last Comic Standing,” and made it all the way to the finals before she was eliminated.
Here’s what to know about her.
She’s a celebrity roast queen
Glaser made the rounds across celebrity roasts, like for Rob Lowe and Alec Baldwin, before the one that blew up: Netflix’s Tom Brady roast, which aired in 2024.
“The roast was such a big moment for me, and my life changed overnight in terms of recognizability and people knowing who I am,” she told The Hollywood Reporter.
In fact, Glaser did so well at the event that she joked the audience at the 2025 Golden Globes were “scared” of what she was going to say about her in the opening monologue.

“I think, when I first walked out (to do the opening monologue), I knew the energy was like, ‘We don’t know what she’s going to do. We’ve seen her do the Tom Brady roast, most recently.’ That’s kind of where I popped for most people,” Glaser said during a conversation at the Time100 Summit on April 23.
She may be famous for them, but she doesn’t love roasts.
“Whenever I’ve done a Comedy Central Roast. I’ve done three of them and at the end of every single one I tell my friends to never let me do another one,” she told Interview magazine.

“It ruins my life for the three weeks I have to get ready for them. Not only am I such a b---- during these stints because I have to change the way my mind works in order to think of such cruel jokes, but I also exhaust myself writing and performing.”
What other TV shows and movies has she been in?
Glaser has made appearances in the movies like "I Feel Pretty" and "Trainwreck," and TV shows like "Adam Ruins Everything" and "A.P. Bio," as an actor.
As herself, she's hosted "Saturday Night Live" and the reality show "FBOY Island." She also spent an episode on "Dancing with the Stars" Season 27.
She had a bonding moment with Taylor Swift
In 2020, Glaser issued an apology to Swift after negative comments she made about the singer’s “skinny” frame had resurfaced online.

Glaser, whose been open about her struggles with anorexia and bulimia, said she regretted making those comments about Swift in the past after she heard about Swift’s own struggles with her body image.

I was probably ‘feeling fat’ that day and was jealous. Also, I’ve had people say the same s--t about me being too skinny before and know how terrible it feels to hear that when you’re struggling,” she said on Instagram.
Swift later responded to Glaser, writing, “Wow. I appreciate this so much.”
She’s in a relationship
Glaser is taken. During “The Roast of Tom Brady,” Glaser called Chris Convy the “love of my life.”

Like Glaser, Convy is also in the entertainment business. He’s a seasoned producer who has worked on awards shows and TV specials including 2019’s “The Little Mermaid Live” and 2022’s “Beauty and the Beast: A 30th Celebration.”
He also served as an executive producer on several of Glaser’s comedy specials, including her most recent HBO special, “Nikki Glaser: Someday You’ll Die.”

title: Chris Pratt Says He's 'Not Sure What to Do' With the 'Massive' Christmas Gift Father-In-Law Arnold Schwarzenegger Gave Him
summary: Chris Pratt is revealing the custom present his father-in-law, Arnold Schwarzenegger, gifted him and three of his children for the holidays.
story: Chris Pratt is revealing the custom present his father-in-law, Arnold Schwarzenegger, gifted him and three of his children for the holidays.

The 46-year-old actor, who has been married to Schwarzenegger’s daughter Katherine Pratt Schwarzenegger since 2019, recently stopped by “The Graham Norton Show” in the UK and chatted about how he spent Christmas with his family.

When host Graham Norton prompted Pratt to share how much his father-in-law loves Christmas, the “Guardians of the Galaxy” actor replied, “His love language is giving gifts, that’s for sure. He just goes all out with his gifts.”

Pratt continued, “This year, one was like a six foot by eight foot portrait painting of all three of my children and him as Santa Claus, and it’s very lifelike and it’s very big and it’s him as Santa Claus and then the three kids peering around the Christmas tree seeing him eat a cookie.”
As the audience laughed, Norton quipped that the present couldn’t be on display the entire year.
“Yeah, I’m not sure exactly what we’re supposed to do with that for the rest of the year,” Pratt agreed. “I think we’ll have to break that out in November sometime.”
He added that the present is so large it will be difficult to store it.
“It’s big. It’s enframed and it’s a big massive canvas,” he explained before also describing the present as “a wonderful decoration” and “very thoughtful gift” for his family.

The action star and Pratt Schwarzenegger share three children together: 5-year-old daughter Lyla Maria, 3-year-old daughter Eloise Christina and 1-year-old son Ford Fitzgerald. He is also a father to 13-year-old son Jack from his previous marriage to Anna Faris.
Pratt received another unique present from Schwarzenegger, as well.
“He also gave me a pair of crocodile boots that he wore in a movie,” Pratt revealed. “We have the same size feet.”
Pratt appeared on “The Graham Norton Show” with Cynthia Erivo, comedian and writer Dawn French and comedian Rob Becket.

After he shared his personal gift, the two comedians playfully teased him that he just received an old pair of shoes. “They’re regifted but they are iconic. He wore them in some movie…” Pratt pushed back.
Becket chimed in and joked, “So iconic you can’t remember the film?”

Pratt has spoken about his close relationship with his father-in-law before. He revealed during an interview with “New York Live” in 2021 that Schwarzenegger frequently quotes iconic lines from his movies when he is around his family.

“He does it all the time, too. He’ll say lines from his movies and stuff. He’ll walk out and be like, ‘I’ll be back,’” he shared. The interview was part of the promotional run for Pratt’s movie “The Tomorrow War,” which included a scene where he said a slightly different version of that same Schwarzenegger line.

“I showed it in front of the whole family and I said, ‘I do have a line. I say, I will be back,’” he recalled. “And you’ll see it just pales in comparison to anytime you’ve ever delivered that iconic line. I’m just saying it like a guy who’s going into the room. There’s nothing iconic about it.”
The respect between the two is mutual as Schwarzenegger proudly gushed about his son-in-law when “Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3” was released in 2023.

At the time, Schwarzenegger tweeted, “I saw #GuardiansOfTheGalaxyVol3  last night and WOW. @prattprattpratt, you crushed it. A non-stop, perfect mix of comedy and action. I loved it and I’m very, very proud of you.”

title: ‘Heated Rivalry’ Fans Are Getting Out Their Post-Show Angst By Baking Cakes
summary: Since the season finale of “Heated Rivalry,” fans have been longing for one more taste of their favorite fictional hockey players — so some are baking cakes.
story: Since the season finale of “Heated Rivalry” aired, fans have been longing for one more taste of their favorite fictional hockey players — so some are baking cakes in honor of the beloved show.

The buzzy Canadian romance series follows professional hockey players Shane Hollander (Hudson Williams) and Ilya Rozanov (Connor Storrie) as they go from enemies to lovers. Audiences have fallen for the the book-turned-series and its longing glances, covert canoodling and competition on and off the rink.
It hit the U.S. in November 2025, and the series’ popularity snowballed over six episodes to become one HBO Max’s top 10 TV shows. Its finale received IMDb’s highest rating of 2025.
And lately, bakers have been immortalizing the icy-hot show with icing.

“Santa’s not the only thing coming this week,” TikToker Jake Eldridge jokes about the show’s abundant and steamy sex scenes in a Dec. 24 video. “I thought, ‘What better thing to bring to the cabin than a big cake?’ And there are much larger cakes in the cabinet, if you’ve been watching the show.”
Eldridge’s buttercream-frosted vanilla cake features Shayne and Ilya’s jerseys, piped lettering and a “big hockey puck” in the center.
“This might be one of the Top 3 best hockey cakes,” one person commented.
Bakeries have also been giving it their best shot, so to speak.

“I sure didn’t expect to open my WORK EMAIL this morning and see these two faces. 😅 I thought I opened the wrong app and freaked out,” posted baker @vanlifegreenie, along with photo, on Threads. “(I work at a bakery and someone wants their beautiful faces on a cake.)”
They then showed off the result on Jan. 3.
“THE LONG-AWAITED CAKE PIC,” they said, noting that the decorator did a “PHENOMENAL” job. “Customer didn’t want to pay for the edible printed image and honestly I think this is better. 🤭.”

Author Abby Jimenez, owner of Nadia Cupcakes, whipped up multiple batches of “Heated Rivalry” cupcakes and says she’s a fan because the show validates romance-centered storytelling and makes queer romance the focus — how it “should be.”

“Shane and Ilya’s love story has truly sparked a cultural phenomenon that put us all in a chokehold,” Jimenez tells TODAY.com. “Our staff is watching the show along with the rest of the world, we are obsessed, and we enjoy making desserts that celebrate the things we love!”
On Dec. 31, Threads user Sarah (@kaleidoscopebakes) posted her “Heated Rivalry”-themed creation — a half ginger ale spice and half chocolate cola cake.

“When I read the books, I knew I had to make a cake inspired by Shane’s love of ginger ale and Ilya’s love of cola someday,” Sarah tells TODAY.com, and that it being her last cake of 2025 “felt so fitting.”
Sarah says the love story is “queer joy” with a “happy ending,” something that’s uncommon for gay and lesbian characters on TV and in movies.
“Despite all of the hardships Shane and Ilya go through, their love is enough to persevere. It’s inspirational and invigorating!” she says.
“‘Heated Rivalry’ also created a safe space for myself and many other queer people during a time where the world continuously doesn’t feel safe,” she says. “I like to think they would love it.”

title: What to Know About Rob Rausch from ‘The Traitors’
summary: Love Island USA's Rob Rausch swaps romance for deception in The Traitors season 4. From snake wrangler to reality TV strategist—can he survive?
story: Rob Rausch was once just a guy looking for his perfect match on “Love Island USA.” Now, the 27-year-old reality TV star has traded the romantic villa out in Fiji for the cutthroat Scottish digs of “The Traitors”— and he’s playing the game as one of the villains.

Peacock’s addictive psychological game show is back for Season 4, during which contestants live together in a castle in Scotland while secretly plotting each other’s demise. (Peacock and TODAY share a parent company, NBCUniversal.)

The premise is devilishly simple: A group of players must work together to complete challenges and build a prize fund, but hidden among them are “traitors” whose job is to secretly eliminate their fellow contestants one by one. Meanwhile, the “faithful” must figure out who the traitors are and vote them off before they’re picked off themselves.
Rob Rausch is a Traitor on Season 4

At the ever so dramatic opening roundtable ceremony, host Alan Cumming tapped Rausch to be one of the season's secret traitors and the reality star couldn't have been more thrilled with the assignment.

“I’m happy as can be. I honestly think I’ll make a really good traitor,” Rausch said after being chosen. “I’m hard to read, I’ve been told that by every girl I’ve ever dated, and I’m extremely competitive. I like to win.”

The country boy sees his underestimated personality as a major advantage in the game. "I've been underestimated my entire life. I’m just a guy from Alabama. I catch snakes, post videos on the internet. I’m kinda quiet, but I think that’s one of my biggest strengths,” he explained. “When people underestimate you that’s when you catch them by surprise.”
Who is Rob Rausch?
Rob Rausch, now 27, is a snake wrangler from Florence, Alabama, according to his “Love Island USA” Season 5 bio, and he grew up on a farm with three siblings.

“Love Island USA” viewers know just how much Rausch loves wildlife. His expertise with snakes and other creatures became his calling card when he began posting snake-wrangling content in 2021 and amassed a devoted following. A quick scroll of his socials will show that he’s still passionate.

His Southern charm, good looks and fearless handling of dangerous reptiles kept an interest even post-“Love Island USA”; when he left the show, the wildlife enthusiast became a bonafide social media influencer. To date, Rausch has 2.2 million followers on TikTok and 1.4 million on Instagram.
What Is Rob Rausch Known For?
While his snake-wrangling videos made him an internet sensation, it was reality TV that truly put Rausch on the map.
He made his “Love Island USA” debut in Season 5 during the Casa Amor episodes — if you know, you know — but was dumped from the island just a few days later.
The villa didn’t bring Rausch love that first summer, but viewers were elated to see him return as an original cast member for “Love Island USA” Season 6 the following year.
This time, he lasted significantly longer in the show, coupling up with cast members like Leah Kateb, Andrea Carmona and Kassy Castillo as he searched for a meaningful connection.

He was ultimately eliminated toward the end of Season 6. His fellow cast members later reunited for spinoff called “Love Island: Beyond the Villa” that followed their lives together in Los Angeles in 2025. Rausch, however, did not appear.

title: ‘People We Meet on Vacation’ Stars Emily Bader, Tom Blyth Share Reality Behind That Steamy Rain Scene
summary: To put it bluntly: "People We Meet on Vacation" isn't about meeting new people on vacation.
story: To put it bluntly: "People We Meet on Vacation" isn't about meeting new people on vacation.

Emily Bader and Tom Blyth co-star in the first installment in author Emily Henry's cinematic universe, which hit Netflix Jan. 9. An homage to "When Harry Met Sally...," the story follows best friends Poppy and Alex from when they meet at college through years of annual summer trips.

The film is a romantic romp, with settings like Barcelona, Tuscany, New Orleans and the woods of Canada, set to a soundtrack consisting of Robyn, Taylor Swift and Paula Abdul. And it hits all the romantic comedy beats: a hilarious miscommunication between Alex and Poppy's dad (played by Alan Ruck), a steamy kiss on a balcony in the pouring rain (the actors say it was frigid) and a sprint to profess one's love (through an Ohio neighborhood, rather than an airport).

The book was first published in May 2021, marking the second in Henry's meteoric run of romantic comedies. She published six books in five years — "Beach Read" (2020), "People We Meet on Vacation" (2021), "Book Lovers" (2022), "Happy Place" (2023), "Funny Story" (2024), "A Great Big Beautiful Life" (2025) — almost all of which are currently optioned for screen adaptations. (On Jan. 8, Deadline reported that "Funny Story" is headed to development at Netflix, while Henry herself is set to write the screenplays for both "Funny Story" and "Happy Place.")
"I think it's so amazing that we got to be a part of the first one," Bader tells TODAY.com in a joint interview with Blyth. "I do think that it's going to be a very long journey for (Henry)."
"Emily Henry's not only a genius, but a very wonderful human being," Bader continues.
"A very thoughtful, emotionally available human being," Blyth adds.

Below, the co-stars unpack answer all on our burning questions, starting with the often mused fan question, why is it called "People We Meet on Vacation"? (Of note, the U.K. version of the book is titled, "You and Me on Vacation.")
Their answer? Surprisingly deep.
This interview has been lightly edited for clarity.
Tom Blyth: Why is it called "People We Meet on Vacation" when it's mostly about the two of us —
Emily Bader: About two people who don't meet on vacation?

TB: I think that's kind of the point. I think it's about these two people meeting new versions of each other again and again and again over time, and falling in love with each other again and again, and more and more. So it's like (gesturing between them) these are the people we meet on vacation.
EB: We meet different versions of ourselves. That's it. Canon now.

EB: It's funny because Poppy almost sort of is taking the role of the man character that you often see in the rom-coms. Like if we're talking "When Harry Met Sally...," (she's) more Billy Crystal. And I think that's really fun. She's very carefree and takes up all the space that she wants to, which I think is an exciting new interpretation.

TB: I think for Alex, his unique spin is the "Vacation Alex" aspect, which is him slowly coming out of his shell because of this person who gives him the power to express himself — epitomized by him stripping off and running into the sea.
EB: Getting naked. (Laughs.)
EB: There's a lot of them. It's very logistical.
TB: Very technical.
EB: A lot of gallon tanks filled with just ice cold, chilly water that they that they just pelt you with.
TB: We'd love to tell you it was super romantic to film the rain scene, but it's very cold and loud because the machines were on non-stop.
EB: And I think it was like 4 in the morning. So we were very delusional. There was a lot of giggling.
TB: And there was a storm in Barcelona anyway so it was already —
EB: It was already raining, but we couldn't —
TB: Couldn't use it because you can't see it on camera. But yeah, we just, we hung in there, relied on each other, and I think we pulled it off.
EB: We'll see.

EB: I think it's so amazing that we got to be a part of the first one. I do think that it's going to be a very long journey for her. Advice? Have fun. They're amazing people. Emily Henry's not only a genius, but a very wonderful human.
TB: Very thoughtful, emotionally available human being.
EB: Emotionally intelligent. And so are the fans of her books.

TB: Lean in. Have fun. You can have that too much fun, that's what I learned. I went into this trying to play Alex — he's quite serious at times. But it's so much fun when he gets to release. And so, yeah, as much release as possible.

EB: I think for Poppy, her music taste is also sort of seen in the way that she dresses. She's someone who reacts really strongly to something that she loves, and once she loves it, it's hers forever, even if it makes absolutely no sense in her closet or her catalog of music. And I love that about her. She just, she likes what she likes, and it's all over the map.
TB: The soundtrack's amazing. (Director) Brett Haley is a musical genius. He picks songs like nobody else. I think it's going to go down in history as a great movie soundtrack.

For Alex, I think the musical side of him that we didn't see, I've seen him described as a black cat boyfriend. Instead of like a golden retriever, he's more of a black cat. And so I think it's like The Smiths. "500 Days of Summer" kind of vibes.
EB: Oh, he is such a "500 Days of Summer" guy. And absolutely no jazz, apparently.
TB: But he's got moves.

title: Craig Melvin Attempts the Worm on TODAY, Coached by 'People We Meet on Vacation' Star Tom Blyth
summary: Craig Melvin interviewed "People We Meet on Vacation" stars Emily Bader and Tom Blyth and received tips on how to perform the worm dance move.
story: Studio 1A or a dance studio?

TODAY co-anchor Craig Melvin was joined by "People We Meet on Vacation" stars Tom Blyth and Emily Bader Jan. 9 to discuss the newly released Netflix romantic comedy — and it resulted in a mini-dance lesson.

Based on Emily Henry's 2021 novel of the same name, "People We Meet on Vacation" is a friends-to-lovers romance between two polar opposites, Poppy (Bader) and Alex (Blyth), who meet in college and maintain a friendship through annual summer trips.

One of those trips took them to New Orleans, during which Alex and Poppy pretend to be married to enjoy some complimentary items. To uphold the ruse, they lean into their alter married egos and perform a “fairly elaborate dance scene" — as Craig describes it — set to Paula Abdul's "Forever Your Girl."
While the scene may look improvised, Blyth and Bader said they actually practiced it for two days straight.
One highlight of the scene is when Blyth's character busts out the worm on the dance floor.
During their interview on TODAY, Craig praised the actor's moves.
"You’re really strong at the worm,” Craig said.
“Oh no,” Blyth responded. “Strong is maybe an over exaggeration.”
Blyth said the worm was not a skill he learned for the film, rather it's one he already had, starting from when he was 8 years old.
"I fancied this girl and this other guy came into the school and did the worm and did a bunch of break dance moves, and he got the girl," Blyth recalls.
"So I went home, and I practiced, and now it's the only takeaway from that experience, was the worm," he added.
Craig then asked for Blyth to demonstrate what makes a "good worm."
"You got to limber up," the actor advised.
Craig then got out of his chair, turning the studio into a makeshift dance floor.
"I was going to help you show the audience," Craig said.
"I'm not going to do the worm," Blyth initially said.
Famous last words.
"If you do it, I'll do it," Craig proposed, as both started to stretch.
Craig then took off his suit jacket, raring to go.
"They warned me about this," Blyth said with a laugh. "Am I going to do the worm on a morning show?"
Seconds later, Blyth executed a flawless "light" version of the worm, to cheers and applause from Bader.
Craig then had to uphold his end of the bargain. He got onto the floor almost in a push-up position and gave his best attempt at rolling his body down in the classic worm motion.
"That was pretty good!" Blyth praised.
Carson Daly, however, had a different take. Carson had to watch it all unfold from Studio 1A, covering his eyes at one point.
"I apologize, Carson," Craig said.
"Is it done?" Carson said, as Craig laughed. "By the way, that was so un-wormy."

title: Connor Storrie of ‘Heated Rivalry’ to Appear on TODAY in Morning Show Debut
summary: "Heated Rivalry" star Connor Storrie will appear on the TODAY show Jan. 14 in his debut on morning television.
story: Connor Storrie is coming to Studio 1A.

The “Heated Rivalry” star will make his morning show debut Jan. 14 on TODAY, stopping by 30 Rock to discuss the hit hockey romance drama series that has taken the world by storm since its U.S. premiere Nov. 28 on HBO Max.

His live interviews, happening in the 8a hour and the 3rd Hour of TODAY, will come two days after he makes his late night debut Jan. 12 on “Late Night with Seth Meyers.” He also announced the nominations for SAG-AFTRA’s Actor Awards Jan. 7 alongside “Abbott Elementary” star Janelle James.

Storrie stars in “Heated Rivalry” as Russian hockey phenom Ilya Rozanov, who plays for Boston’s team in a fictionalized professional hockey league. Well before his rookie season, he meets young Canadian star player Shane Hollander, played by fellow breakout actor Hudson Williams, and they strike up a years-long romantic dalliance, which is chronicled over the show’s six episodes.
Like Storrie, Williams just made his late night debut, appearing on “The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon” Jan. 7, sparking fan fervor and crowds in and around 30 Rock for his appearance.
While “Heated Rivalry” Season 1 wrapped with its Dec. 26 finale, the show is already renewed for Season 2. Canadian streamer Crave announced the show’s renewal Dec. 12.
“Heated Rivalry” is based on Rachel Reid’s hockey romance novel of the same name, which first published in 2019. Shane and Ilya’s love story continued in her 2022 novel, “The Long Game.”

title: ‘The Traitors’ Season 4 Episodes 1-3 Recap: Who Was Banished and Who Was Murdered?
summary: Who goes home on the first week of the Traitors season 4? Find out who goes home and who was banished from The Traitors this season.
story: Alan Cumming has returned to his Scottish Castle where 23 celebrities are ready to be sneaky and savage as they face off in Season 4 of “The Traitors.”

The Emmy-winning Peacock competition series is back with the same murderous game mechanics and a new twist that will keep even the viewers second guessing who they can trust. The first four episodes of Season 4 arrived on Peacock Thursday, Jan. 8 with a supersized premiere that quickly introduced fans to the 23 cast members — featuring multiple “Real Housewives” alums, Olympians, Survivor winners and more celebrities — who learned if they have to play the game as a Faithful or a Traitor.

But before they stepped foot into the castle, Cumming announced a new element: he would select a “Secret Traitor” in plain sight in front of everyone. That player’s identity would remain hidden from everyone, including the audience, until later on in the game. He later selected his group of Traitors, and the Faithfuls set off to unmask them.
By the end of Episode 3, multiple players were banished, some were murdered and one Traitor was discovered. Read on for a recap of all the plotting and drama that went down.
Episode 1

The premiere begins with all of the players arriving at the darkened castle. After briefly meeting each other and seeing some familiar faces, they are informed about Cumming’s “Secret Traitor” twist. Each player has a box with their name on it. One by one, they approach Cumming and he shows if their box contains a grim reaper card, confirming them as the Secret Traitor. Their identity is withheld from the audience. Everyone then moves into the castle and gathers around the Round Table for Cumming to choose the other Traitors.

After covertly circling the room multiple times, he selects three Traitors to join his turret: “The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills” alum Lisa Rinna, former “The Real Housewives of Potomac” star Candiace Dillard Bassett and Rob Rausch from “Love Island USA” Season 6. Later in the turret that night, the three learn about the Secret Traitor (who wears a special red cloak) and their power. Every week, the Secret Traitor creates a shortlist of players to be murdered until all the Traitors have the chance to team up.

The first mission requires the cast to divide into groups of three and find coffins marked with dollar signs in a loch. The coffins are then placed in one of the player’s graves, meaning they are at risk for murder. At the end, nine players are on the chopping block.

Back at the mansion, “The Real Housewives of Atlanta” star Porsha Williams confronts actor Michael Rapaport after hearing from Dillard Bassett that he wanted to target all the housewives. But Dillard Bassett says that Williams misheard her, leading to more confusion. Cumming announces at the end of the episode to the audience that the Secret Traitor chose four out of the nine at risk players to be on the shortlist for murder. The three Traitors receive a letter from the Secret Traitor with the four names: Rausch, Ian Terry from “Big Brother,” Mark Ballas from “Dancing With the Stars” and singer-songwriter Eric Nam.
Episode 2

The episode opens with “The Traitors” tradition of having each player arrive for breakfast except one. Viewers discover that the Traitors chose to murder Ian Terry. In his final confessional, a disappointed Terry says, “I had a feeling that was going to be the case. I just don’t know what I could’ve done differently. But, you know what, this is the biggest backhanded compliment in this game.”

Before the players depart for the second mission, Williams slips up again by accidentally saying that she “killed” Terry, causing comedian Ron Funches’ ears to perk up. At the mission, more drama unfolds, this time between “Survivor” winner Yamil “Yam Yam” Arocho and “Love Island” UK star Maura Higgins. The players have to transport three players on a throne back to the castle. Along the way, they have to make multiple stops and collect gold or shields. The last players on the throne when they reach the castle will be safe from murder. Arocho takes Higgins' spot on the throne, securing his safety for the night, and Rapaport inserts himself in the conversation by claiming that he also needed a shield. He continues to call out Arocho in front of everyone when they return to the mansion. Meanwhile, Williams errs again by mentioning that there are four Traitors, adding to the list of evidence Funches is compiling.

At the first Round Table, “Survivor” winner Natalie Anderson kicks things off by explaining why she thinks Donna “Mama” Kelce is a Traitor. But Funches’ theory about Williams is more compelling. It is a close vote, but Williams receives one more vote than Kelce and is banished. While standing on the Circle of Truth, Williams says, “I came in and I tried to fight for the housewives and it almost started to feel like I’m going to be the one who is going to help to lead us to find a Traitor the first time. I am a Faithful.” The group is stunned and Funches says in his confessional that he feels like he put a target on his back.

Toward the end of Episode 2, the Traitors are tasked with completing a covert murder in plain sight. The Traitors must find a set of tarot cards hidden in the kitchen that reveal the second shortlist from the Secret Traitor. Next, they have to take the card of the person they want to murder and burn it in the fireplace in the breakfast room. If successful, they can meet the Secret Traitor and unite. If unsuccessful, there will not be a murder that night and they will not have any control over the next murder.

Rausch spots the red reaper painting in the kitchen and instantly knows that is where the tarot cards are hidden. Meanwhile, Dillard Bassett starts a Conga line to distract the rest of the players. But “Survivor” star Rob Cesternino isn’t fooled. He tells “Big Brother” alum Tiffany Mitchell that he suspects a murder is happening in plain sight and she needs to stay alert. He also shares this theory with Dillard Bassett and Ballas.

Rausch takes the tarot cards to Rinna and they discuss the shortlist: “RuPaul’s Drag Race” star Monét X Change, Olympic figure skater Tara Lipinski, “Top Chef” host Kristen Kish and Cesternino. The two Traitors slip away to the breakfast room, without having time to consult with Dillard Bassett, and burn one card, murdering a player.
Episode 3

All the players safely arrive to breakfast the next morning except one: Cesternino. We see a flashback where he learned his fate. “I don’t know how they got me. I leave with no regrets. Traitors, I’ll get you next time,” he says.

Rapaport abruptly starts targeting Arocho again about the shield from the last mission, rubbing multiple players the wrong way. Cumming arrives and shocks the players by sharing that there will be a morning Round Table meeting and banishment. Many of the players meet and agree that they will vote for Kelce to be banished. Kelce attempts to defend herself and suggests that Rapaport is a Traitor.
But the players stand firm on their decision to banish her. They all vote to remove her from the game except Rapaport, who voted for Arocho, and Kelce, who voted for Rapaport.

While standing on the Circle of Truth, Kelce says, “I know I’m the sacrificial lamb and I know that I had a blast meeting every single one of you. On that note, I think I’m going to go … but you got yourself a Traitor!”

Kelce is then revealed as the Secret Traitor who was chosen by Cumming when they first arrived. The episode “rewinds” to show the moments she met in secret with Cumming and planned her shortlists. Kelce says in her confessional that her strategy was to be a lovable mom figure during the day and a “devious Traitor at night.” She says that she targeted players with her shortlists who were laying low and not speaking up.

Reflecting on her game, she says, “Playing a Traitor was tough but I gave it my best shot. This has been a dream come true.” Getting emotional, she adds, “These are happy tears that I get to do this at this point in my life. It’s just the joy of being in the game.”

Cumming asks each player to pair up with the person they trust most. Funches is the odd person out, so he will be automatically shortlisted for murder. The duos select one person to be put in a cage and another to hunt for skulls and stack them in a tower. Kish, “The Real Housewives of Dubai” star Caroline Stanbury, Rinna and Nam’s partners are all unsuccessful which means they are at risk.

The at-risk players are left behind and tied to trees where they wait to find out if they will be murdered by the Traitors face to face. After making their decision in the turret, the Traitors go to the woods and meet with each player. Nam pleads for his life in the game. Kish says she won’t beg. Stanbury says she isn’t ready to go and Funches threatens the Traitors.
He says if they don’t kill him now they will regret it later. “Show me your faces!” he shouts as the episode ends.
Episodes 4 and 5 of “The Traitors” Season 4 will stream on Peacock Thursday, Jan. 15 at 6 p.m. PT/ 9 p.m. ET.

title: Mandy Moore, Husband Taylor Goldsmith and More Throw Concert to Commemorate 1 Year Since the Eaton Fire
summary: Mandy Moore, her husband Taylor Goldsmith, his band Dawes and more came together to commemorate one year since the Eaton fire in Altadena.
story: For one night, musicians “united under tragedy” to commemorate one year since the Eaton Fire forever changed the Altadena, California, community.
A Concert for Altadena, held on Jan. 7 at the Pasadena Civic Auditorium, was an emotional and uplifting night presented by the band Dawes.

On Jan. 7, 2025, a fire blazed through the Eaton canyon, making its way towards the mountain town of Altadena. On the far west side of Los Angeles, the Palisades fire was also blazing and wreaking havoc. A total of 31 people died and the fires destroyed about 13,000 homes and residential properties, leaving thousands displaced.

To pay tribute to the lives, homes and businesses lost, the one-night benefit concert brought the Altadena community together in hopes of raising money for the Altadena Builds Back Foundation. The organization helps provide resources and options for people who want to stay and rebuild in Altadena.

“We were all affected in different ways. Every person in Altadena was affected at once, but everyone’s stories are unique and different,” co-producer and co-organizer Kevin Lyman, the creator of Warped Tour and longtime Altadena resident, tells TODAY.com. “(We are) united under one tragedy.”

Approached by Dawes and guitarist Eric Krasno, Lyman teamed up with the two and began producing a show to support the community, raise funds and provide 250 tickets to Altadena residents directly impacted by the fire.

The support was immediate. Everyone who helped with the production, Lyman says, were friends who became “extended family.” The participants also had ties to Altadena, Palisades or Los Angeles and were impacted by the fires.

“I think in Altadena now, we’re all an extended family,” Lyman says, before noting the similarities between rebuilding the town and producing a show for the community. “It’s such a huge undertaking that if you look at it as a whole, it’s overwhelming... And all we want to do is bring people together.”

Hosted by actor and Altadena resident John C. Reilly, taking the stage during the over three-hour event was Taboo from Black Eyed Peas, who performed “Stand Strong,” his song with his daughter Jett Gomez. Jenny Lewis, Ozomatli, Everclear, Aloe Blacc, Rufus Wainwright, Lord Huron, Judith Hill and Lucius were also part of the line up.

Mandy Moore performed her early hit single “Candy” alongside husband Taylor Goldsmith, singer and guitarist of Dawes. The “This Is Us” star and her family’s home was impacted by the fire, with her in-laws and family losing their houses.
Earlier in the day, Moore had expressed how grateful she was to give back to her town after so much “trauma and grief.”

“My heart is with everyone affected: the lives that were lost and the lives that were forever changed on both sides of our beautiful city,” she wrote on Instagram, in part. “I’m grateful for the chance to gather tonight and celebrate how resilient Altadena is; to be in community with one another and MUSIC to commemorate what we’ve lived through and what comes next. I am endlessly grateful to those near and far who supported Los Angeles in our time of need. The work has only just begun but we’re in it together. Altadena forever.”

Brad Paisley played guitar with several artists and performed his song with Dawes, “Raining Inside.” Brandon Flowers from The Killers also helped close out the show before Dawes concluded the event with all their friends.

Speakers from Habitat For Humanity, as well as Altadena Girls, also participated in the event, expressing uplifting words and preaching “Altadena Strong.” Students from Pasadena Waldorf School, which is permanently closed after being damaged by the fire, attended, too.

With rebuilding efforts slowly happening, and only about 10 homes rebuilt so far, according to The Associated Press, the event was able to raise more than $450,000 for the Altadena Builds Back Foundation. There is still an online auction happening through Feb. 21.

“I walk out of my house and I start hearing hammers and I hear saws and I hear trucks coming... (It’s) the sound of rebuilding. That’s how you build a song, one note at a time,” Lyman tells TODAY.com. “Then it becomes, hopefully, something people love — and that’s what Altadena will become again. It’s going to change... It never will be (the same), but that’s OK.”

title: Meghan Trainor Appears to Address 'Toxic' Mom Group Drama in a Blunt New Response
summary: After "High School Musical" star Ashley Tisdale penned a scathing first-person essay for The Cut about her "toxic" mom group, celebrities have been responding.
story: After "High School Musical" star Ashley Tisdale penned a scathing first-person essay for The Cut about her "toxic" mom group, celebrities have been responding. And they are not, in fact, all in this together.
In her essay, Tisdale wrote how she was initially energized by joining a mom group of friends who happened to be having babies at the same time. Eventually, however, she began to feel left out.
